    • Summary: Behind the Smiles by Reveal
      I can't help but draw parallels between the almost robotic efficiency expected from humans in these warehouses to slaughterhouses in factory farms. The ever-increasing demand for stuff(packages and meat) has pushed industries to meet it at the expense of human, animal and planet health. It's a classic case of human greed and indifference taking a toll on anyone and anything that's poor and helpless.

    • My First Ultra
      I was turning 30 in October and a random goal popped in my mind - to run at least 30 miles. The shortest official distance that meets the criterion is 50k, which is about 32 miles. The longest I had run so far was a 35k the year before, which is about 22.5 miles. So it looked like an ambitious, formidable, yet doable challenge. It was past the Labor Day weekend, so I had already lost the first week of September...
